thread.title: Oscars 2017: La La Land ’s “City of Stars” Wins Best Original Song
thread.title_full: Oscars 2017: La La Land ’s “City of Stars” Wins Best Original Song

author: Noah Yoo
title: Oscars 2017: La La Land ’s “City of Stars” Wins Best Original Song
text:
Oscars 2017: La La Land ’s “City of Stars” Wins Best Original Song Beating out Justin Timberlake, Lin-Manuel Miranda, and Sting 
La La Land has won the Academy Award for Best Original Song, for the track “City of Stars.” The song was written by Justin Hurwitz, Benj Pasek and Justin Paul. Hurwitz, Pasek, and Paul were all present at the ceremony to accept the award; Hurwitz also won the award for Best Original Score . “City of Stars” beat out songs by Justin Timberlake, Lin-Manuel Miranda, and Sting in the Best Original Song category. Miranda would have EGOT’d had he won the Grammy for Best Original Song. 
For more of Pitchfork’s coverage of this year’s Oscars, click here . Tags In This Story
